channel.title: Etching on Ric - An unknown artist

Notes: This print is also part of the Collection of watercolours paintings .

item.title: Hedwig Klinge Magnolias
item.author: mail@christianmahnke.de (Christian Mahnke)
item.description:
Short description: A etching of Magnolias by Hedwig Klinge, wife of Fritz Neumann.

Notes: Thanks to Mark Strong of Meibohm Fine Arts for providing the image. Note, that the JCB blind embossing is clearly visible.

Images by Mark Strong of Meibohm Fine Arts .

item.title: Hedwig Klinge Girl and dog
item.author: mail@christianmahnke.de (Christian Mahnke)
item.description:
Short description: A etching of a small girl and a dog by Hedwig Klinge, wife of Fritz Neumann.

Notes: This is a Aprils fools day post, since the image itself is attributed to Max Klinger , see last photo. It was also offered on the web a a work by Max Klinger.

item.title: Fritz Neumann Terrier found by Mark Strong
item.author: mail@christianmahnke.de (Christian Mahnke)
item.description:
Short description: Etching of a Tiger by Fritz Neumann.

Notes: Thanks to Mark Strong of Meibohm Fine Arts for providing the images.

Images by Mark Strong of Meibohm Fine Arts .

item.title: Three Fritz Neumann prints of birds

item.description:

Notes: Found on eBay.

item.title: Print of a bird by Fritz Neumann
item.author: mail@christianmahnke.de (Christian Mahnke)
item.description:
Short description: A colourised print of a bird by Fritz Neumann. The bird is either a Baltimore oriole or another New World oriole species. Since there are no records that Neumann has ever been in America (yet), he might have seen it at an Aviary.

Notes: Found on eBay

item.title: An unknown etching of a flamingo by Fritz Neumann
item.author: mail@christianmahnke.de (Christian Mahnke)
item.description:
Short description: Coloured etching of a flamingo by Fritz Neumann

Notes: Found on in an antiquarian bookshop in Hannover. The embossed mark of J.C. Blumenberg is clearly recognisable. Matching the title of the newspaper article on Fritz Neumann .

item.title: Fritz Neumann "Kiel Kriegshafen"
item.author: mail@christianmahnke.de (Christian Mahnke)
item.description:
Short description: A etching of a the war harbour Kiel by Fritz Neumann.

Notes: Found on eBay . this has been brought to my attention by Torsten Steinberg. As he has noted this has almost certainly a wrong attribution: The stem points to a ship after the First World War, probably the Königsberg or a ship from the class , built after 1927, so the authorship of Hermann Fritz Neumann (1858 - 1920) can be ruled out.

item.title: Fritz Neumann "Der Erbhof"
item.author: mail@christianmahnke.de (Christian Mahnke)
item.description:
Short description: A colourised etching of a hereditary farm by Fritz Neumann.

Notes: There is also a print (certainly from a magazine) of this etching on eBay . Keep in mind, that those aren’t woodcuts!

item.title: An unknown etching by Fritz Neumann
item.author: mail@christianmahnke.de (Christian Mahnke)
item.description:
Short description: Coloured etching of a duck pond by Fritz Neumann

Notes: Found on a flea market (Flohmarkt Flohschanze) in Hamburg. The embossed mark of J.C. Blumenberg is clearly recognisable.

item.title: Two prints from one plate (Fritz Neumann)
item.author: mail@christianmahnke.de (Christian Mahnke)
item.description:
Short description: Two prints from one plate, another fox terrier.

Notes: The first is taken from the Linosaurus Blog . Note the mark under the signature, Holsten Gate variant.
The second is taken from Cofart.be . The colourisation above the eye is different. Note that the signature is different and it has a title (”Ali Baba”), no stamp mark visible.

item.title: A kitten by Fritz Neumann
item.author: mail@christianmahnke.de (Christian Mahnke)
item.description:
Short description: A kitten

Notes: Taken from eBay . This on got the Holsten Gate variant of the mark - image of it is lost.
